title: 109_hr5913
content: The "Voter Integrity Protection Act of 2006" requires proof of citizenship for casting a ballot. The "Voter Integrity Protection Act of 2006" mandates proof of citizenship at polling places for individuals voting in person or by mail for federal elections. The "Voter Integrity Protection Act of 2006" requires individuals voting by mail for federal elections to submit a photographic proof of US citizenship with their ballot, unless they have already provided proof of citizenship to the election official during voter registration. The "Voter Integrity Protection Act of 2006" mandates that individuals voting by mail for federal elections must provide photographic proof of US citizenship, excluding driver's licenses as proof unless citizenship was verified during issuance. Amendments include changing the purpose of driver's licenses and updating the table of contents. The "Voter Integrity Protection Act of 2006" requires proof of citizenship for mail-in voters in federal elections, effective from the November 2008 general election onwards. Additionally, the Act mandates photo identification for voting. The "Voter Integrity Protection Act of 2006" mandates photo identification for voting under SEC. 304. The "Voter Integrity Protection Act of 2006" requires individuals to present valid photo identification issued by a governmental entity when voting in person or submit a copy with a mail-in ballot for Federal elections. States must offer free photo identifications for voting purposes. The "Voter Integrity Protection Act of 2006" mandates free government-issued photo identification for individuals to vote in State elections. The identification provided cannot be used for any other government purposes. States must comply with these requirements starting from the November 2008 general election for Federal office. 303(b)(1) of the "Voter Integrity Protection Act of 2006" is amended to include section 304. Section 401 is also amended to include section 304 for enforcement. The table of contents is updated to reflect these changes. Sec. 304 of the "Voter Integrity Protection Act of 2006" requires voters to present photo identification. Payments to states are provided to cover costs of making photo identifications available for voting. The Commission will reimburse States for costs incurred in providing photo identifications for voting under the program. The amount of payment to each State will be based on the expenses incurred in carrying out the program. Authorization of appropriations is provided for payments under this program for fiscal year 2008 and beyond. "Part 7--Payments To Cover Costs of Providing Photo Identifications for voting. Authorization of appropriations for payments to States. SEC. 4. WITHHOLDING OF HIGHWAY FUNDS." Chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, is amended to include new requirements for preventing voting fraud. States that do not comply will have a percentage of their apportioned funds withheld, starting at 10% in 2009 and increasing to 40% in 2012 and beyond. Compliance is determined by the Election Assistance Commission's assessment of the state's law enforcement efforts. The Election Assistance Commission enforces a law that requires states to meet specific requirements related to the Help America Vote Act of 2002. If a state fails to comply, a portion of their funds will be withheld, with the possibility of increasing penalties over time. Compliance is assessed by the Election Assistance Commission. Requirements for preventing voting fraud.
